data.title: Clayton County Public Schools
data.text:
Clayton County Public Schools (CCPS) is excited to share that the 2024 Treasure Hunt Gala & Conference will be held at Clayton State University from October 6-9!

Read More about CCPS Shares 2024 Treasure Hunt Gala & Conference Information

Clayton County Public Schools is excited to share information about the Georgia Teacher Initiative. This program is designed to provide educators with access to various grants and valuable resources tailored specifically for teachers.

Read More about Empower Georgiaâ€™s Educators: Sign Up for the Georgia Teacher Initiative Today!

The Department of Science is excited to host our first Curriculum Cadre of the year, and we invite all educators to join us on Thursday, August 22, 2024.

Read More about Attention CCPS Science Educators - Elementary and Secondary Science Cadres

As we begin the new school year, the district would like to encourage all students, employees, and stakeholders to adhere to CCPS Contagious Disease guidelines in our efforts to maintain a healthy and safe environment for all.

Read More about CCPS Contagious Disease Guidelines | Translations Provided

Due to a delay in the production and distribution of the CCPS Athletic Passes, employees of Clayton County Public Schools will need to use their Employee ID Badges to gain free entry into the football games being played Friday and Saturday, August 16-17, 2024.

Read More about Distribution of 2024-2025 CCPS Athletic Pass Cards Delayed

As the 2024-2025 school year unfolds, Clayton County Public Schools (CCPS) reminds all stakeholders of safety measures in place to foster a safe learning environment for our students and a protected working environment for our employees.

Read More about CCPS Gears Up for Athletic Season by Reminding Stakeholders about Important Safety Measures

Clayton County Public Schools is excited to launch a new employee recognition initiative, "You've Been Noticed".

Read More about You've Been Noticed: Department of Engagement Launches New Employee Recognition Initiative

Clayton County Public Schools (CCPS) is proud to host the 7th Annual Mental Health Awareness 5K Run & Walk on Saturday, September 21, 2024, at the Clayton County International Park, located at 2300 Hwy 138 S.E. in Jonesboro.

Read More about CCPS to Host 7th Annual Mental Health Awareness 5K Run & Walk

Clayton County Public Schools (CCPS) will host a groundbreaking ceremony to signal the beginning of the construction/modernization project at Lovejoy High School on Tuesday, September 17,2024.

Read More about CCPS Announces Lovejoy HS Groundbreaking Ceremony
